newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany's Kinkel hails Tadic war-crimes conviction.
newsitem.headline: Germany's Kinkel hails Tadic war-crimes conviction.

text.p: German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel on Thursday hailed the conviction of Bosnian Serb Dusan Tadic by a U.N. war crimes tribunal as an important step toward peace and reconciliation in former Yugoslavia.

Wednesday's judgment on the 41-year-old police reservist was the first passed in a full-length trial since the tribunal was set up in the Hague, in the Netherlands, by the United Nations Security Council in May 1993.
"With this conviction the court has made an important contribution to bringing peace and reconciliation to the former Yugoslavia," Kinkel said in a statement.

He said Tadic's conviction for crimes against humanity for his part in an "ethnic cleansing" campaign against Bosnian Moslems in 1992, sent out a clear message to other war criminals that they would not escape justice.
